Class TrackerItemManager

    public class TrackerItemManager
extends AbstractEntityManagerImpl
implements java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.FilterHandler<TrackerItemDto>
    Business Layer tracker item management.
    See Also:
    TrackerItemNotificationManager

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TrackerItemManager.ActionOptions
      These options can be passes via an EnumSet as ActionData data
      class  TrackerItemManager.AfterTransitionCall 
      class  TrackerItemManager.BeforeTransitionCall 
      protected class  TrackerItemManager.CopyAction
      A TransactionCallback that simply invokes copyItems with the specified parameters inside a new transaction
      class  TrackerItemManager.EscalationLoader
      A special Runnable that periodically loads the next chunk of scheduled task escalations from the database and feeds them into the ScheduledExecutorService queue.
      class  TrackerItemManager.EscalationTrigger
      A special Trigger, that fires the specified scheduled tracker item escalation, when the due date has arrived.
      static class  TrackerItemManager.FieldChangeFilter
      A special TrackerItemHistoryEntryDto Predicate, to filter inaccessible field changes from the change history
      class  TrackerItemManager.FieldValueAggregator
      A special Runnable that allows to schedule the rebuilding of aggregated tracker item field values and that is able to repeat the request in case a dead-lock occurred
      protected class  TrackerItemManager.MoveAction
      A TransactionCallback that simply invokes moveItems with the specified parameters inside a new transaction
      class  TrackerItemManager.ReminderTrigger
      A special Trigger for tracker item reminders, that simply sends a reminder email for the subject to the specified user
      class  TrackerItemManager.TrackerHierarchyEscalationScheduler
      A special TrackerHierarchy Visitor to rebuild tracker item escalation schedules of derived trackers upon escalation rule changes on a template tracker.
      class  TrackerItemManager.TrackerHierarchyFieldValueAggregator
      A special TrackerHierarchy Visitor to rebuild aggregated field values of derived trackers upon aggregation rule changes on a template tracker.
      class  TrackerItemManager.TrackerItemEnumeration
      A special Enumeration to iterate over all items of tracker in an efficient way.
      static class  TrackerItemManager.TrackerItemEscalationFilter
      A special TrackerItemEscalationScheduleDto Predicate, to filter already fired escalations from the schedule
      class  TrackerItemManager.TransitionAction 
      static class  TrackerItemManager.TransitionChangeFilter
      A special TrackerItemHistoryEntryDto Predicate, to filter old and new values from the changes caused by a state transition, based on the user field permissions in the old and new status.
      class  TrackerItemManager.Trigger
      The abstract base class for Callables, that fires the specified scheduled tracker item escalation, when the due date has arrived
      class  TrackerItemManager.UpdateTracker
      A helper class to keep track of already processed items when executing referencing item field updates

      • lockBranch

        protected java.lang.Integer lockBranch(TrackerItemDto item)
                                throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Lock the item/issue parent/child hierarchy branch of the specified item. This is necessary to prevent possible deadlocks, when one thread updates a node high in the branch and distributes the changes down the hierarchy, while parallel an other thread updates a node further down the same hierarchy and aggregates the values up the hierarchy.
        Note: Since CB-6.0.1 we only return the branch Id as an immutable Integer, to prevent that this ID changes betweenlocking and unlocking which results in deadlocks
        Parameters:
        item - whose branch to lock
        Returns:
        the Id of the locked branch, that must be passed to unlockBranch(Integer)
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if the lock could not be acquired within LOCK_DEADLINE milliseconds, probably caused by a dead-lock where one thread holds a branch lock and acquires another, that in turn is held by a second thread that waits for the lock already held by this thread.

      • unlockBranch

        protected void unlockBranch(java.lang.Integer branchId)
        Unlock the item/issue parent/child hierarchy branch of the specified item. The lock must have been acquired before via lockBranch(TrackerItemDto) by the same thread.
        Parameters:
        branchId - is the ID of the parent/child hierarchy branch to unlock
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalMonitorStateException - if the current thread did not hold the lock for this branch

      • initialize

        public WorkflowTransitionDto initialize(UserDto user,
                               TrackerItemDto item,
                               java.util.List<TrackerLayoutLabelDto> fields,
                               WorkflowTransitionDto transition,
                               TrackerItemDto sourceTrackerItem)
        Initialize an in memory TrackerItemDto with default values. This does not persist the item changes at all!
        Parameters:
        user - is the current use
        item - is the item to initialize
        fields - The fields to initialize: list of TrackerLayoutLabelDto
        transition - is the state transition to apply, or null
        sourceTrackerItem - is the original tracker item from which the new one will be derived, or null if none. This is typically a requirement or change request.
        Returns:
        the applied transition, or null if none was applied

        rule - is the escalation rule that defines the time offset and unit
        calendar - is the calendar to use
        date - is the date to shift
        worktime - is the WorkTimeCalendar to use, or null to shift calendar time
        Returns:
        the shifted date

      • schedule

        protected java.util.List<TrackerItemEscalationScheduleDto> schedule(TrackerItemDto item,
                                                        TrackerLayoutDto tracker,

                                                        com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.util.WorkTimeCalendar worktime)
        Schedule escalations for the specified tracker item according to the specified escalation rules

        tracker - is the layout of the tracker
        rules - are the escalation rules
        anchorDates - is a Map of rule escalation anchor dates per type of anchor and field

      • updateTrackerItemsAfterTrackerLayoutChange

        public void updateTrackerItemsAfterTrackerLayoutChange(UserDto user,
                                              TrackerDto tracker,
                                              TrackerLayoutDto oldLayout,
                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,TrackerChoiceOptionDto>> oldChoices)
                                                throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        This method should be called after a tracker layout update was committed, with the old layout before the update, to check the consequences of layout changes for tracker item values, like - delete values of removed fields - rebuild aggregated values when aggregation rules have changed. Important: The database transaction, that has updated the tracker layout, must have been committed before calling this method, because some operations will be run via a background service, that might otherwise not see the changes.
        Parameters:
        user - that updates the tracker layout
        tracker - whose items to update
        oldLayout - of the tracker before the update
        oldChoices - are the old static choice field options before the update
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if a branch lock could not be acquired in reasonable time (possible deadlock)

      • updateTrackerItemsAfterChoiceOptionChange

        public void updateTrackerItemsAfterChoiceOptionChange(UserDto user,
                                             TrackerDto tracker,
                                             java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> fields,
                                             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,TrackerChoiceOptionDto>> oldValues)
        Since CB-5.5 TrackerItemDto and TrackerChoiceOptionDto have TrackerChoiceOptionDto.getFlags() and the flags of the item status and the item resolution are aggregated into the tracker item flags. This means that changing choice option flags could also require updating tracker item flags accordingly.
        Parameters:
        user - that modified the choice options
        tracker - is the tracker
        fields - are the fields whose choice options were modified
        oldValues - is a Map of the old choice options per field before the modification
        Since:
        5.5

                                                 java.util.Map<ReferenceDto<?>,ReferableDto> itemRefs)
        Preliminarily create the specified items (including children, recursively) and add the items in pre-order to the itemRefs map Important! Only the basic item information is created, no history/references/field values/
        Parameters:
        transaction - is the enclosing transaction
        user - is the creator of the items
        items - are the current items to create
        itemRefs - is a Map where to store a reference of current/old item id to item
        Returns:
        a flat list of all created items in pre-order
        Since:
        CB-7.2.1

      • findByFilters

        public com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.PaginatedDtoList<TrackerItemDto> findByFilters(UserDto user,
                                                                                    java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> trackerIds,
                                                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Collection<java.lang.String>> orFilters,
                                                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Collection<java.lang.String>> andFilters,
                                                                                    java.util.Date changedSince,
                                                                                    int page,
                                                                                    int pageSize)
        Find the specified page of issues in the specified trackers matching the (choice/reference field) filters and/or modified in the last X days.

        Since CB-6.0 you can also specify filters for non-choice fields. In this case the first parameter can optionally be the comparison operator. If no comparison operator is specified "IN" is implied. For all comparison operators except "IN" and "NOT IN" only the first parameter will be used.

        Parameters:
        user - to check access permissions
        trackerIds - where to look for issues
        orFilters - is a Map of (field) filters, where key = field ID and value is a Collection of choice value names (static choice field) or for reference fields: a (comma separated list of) interwiki reference "[typename:objectid]" or "typeid-objectid", where at least one filter (if any) must match.
        andFilters - is a Map of (field) filters, where key = field ID and value is a Collection of choice value names (static choice field) or for reference fields: a (comma separated list of) interwiki reference "[typename:objectid]" or "typeid-objectid", where all filters (if any) must match.
        changedSince - is optional, filters for issues which are submitted/changed since the date
        page - is the number of the result page to return, first page is 0.
        pageSize - if the number of items per page
        Returns:
        the specified page of issues in the specified trackers matching the (choice field) filters and/or modified in the last X days

      • findByOwner

        public java.util.List<TrackerItemDto> findByOwner(UserDto user,
                                         java.util.Collection<?> fields,
                                         UserDto subject,
                                         boolean onlyDirectUserItems,
                                         java.util.Collection<?> projects,
                                         java.util.Collection<?> trackers,
                                         java.lang.Boolean cmdb,
                                         java.util.Set<TrackerItemDto.Flag> flags,
                                         Criteria criteria,
                                         int timeFilter)
        Get all tracker items where the specified subject is directly (and indirectly) referenced in the specified (member) fields.
        Parameters:
        user - is the user that requests the items referencing the specified subject
        fields - is a collection of (member) fields or field ids
        subject - is the user that should be directly (and indirectly) referenced in the specified (member) fields
        onlyDirectUserItems - true to only look for items where the subject is directly referenced, false to also check indirect references via roles
        projects - is a collection of projects to restrict the result to, or null (all projects where the subject has items)
        trackers - is a collection of trackers to restrict the result to, or null (all trackers where the subject has items)
        cmdb - is TRUE to only consider CMDB items, FALSE to only consider issues and null to consider anything in the specified trackers
        flags - is a Set of flags that should not be set on the items, or null to return all matching items not deleted
        criteria - is additional criteria for the items, or null (no additional criteria)
        timeFilter - is a TF_XXX constant, e.g. TF_OVERDUE to only return overdue items, default: TF_NOFILTER
        Returns:
        items (in the specified projects and/or trackers) where the specified subject is directly (and indirectly) referenced in the specified (member) fields

      • findByOwner

        public com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.PaginatedDtoList<TrackerItemDto> findByOwner(UserDto user,
                                                                                  java.util.Collection<?> fields,
                                                                                  UserDto subject,
                                                                                  boolean onlyDirectUserItems,
                                                                                  java.util.Collection<ProjectDto> projects,
                                                                                  java.util.Collection<?> trackers,
                                                                                  java.lang.Boolean cmdb,
                                                                                  java.util.Set<TrackerItemDto.Flag> flags,
                                                                                  Criteria criteria,
                                                                                  int timeFilter,
                                                                                  com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.PaginatedDtoList<TrackerItemDto> page)
        Get the specified page of all tracker items where the specified subject is directly (and indirectly) referenced in the specified (member) fields.
        Parameters:
        user - is the user who executes the query and is used for permission filtering
        fields - is a collection of (member) fields or field ids
        subject - is the user that should be directly (and indirectly) referenced in the specified (member) fields
        onlyDirectUserItems - true to only look for items where the subject is directly referenced, false to also check indirect references via roles
        projects - is collection of projects (ids), or null (all accessible projects)
        trackers - is a collection of trackers to restrict the result to, or null (all trackers where the subject has items)
        cmdb - is TRUE to only consider CMDB items, FALSE to only consider issues and null to consider anything in the specified trackers
        flags - is a Set of flags that should not be set on the items, or null to return all matching items not deleted or closed
        criteria - is additional criteria for the items, or null (no additional criteria)
        timeFilter - is a TF_XXX constant, e.g. TF_OVERDUE to only return overdue items, default: TF_NOFILTER
        page - is the specification of the page (incl. sorting) to return

      • transferItems

        protected java.util.Map<TrackerItemDto,TrackerItemDto> transferItems(UserDto user,
                                                         org.springframework.transaction.TransactionStatus transaction,
                                                         TrackerDto tracker,
                                                         TrackerItemDto parent,
                                                         Position position,
                                                         boolean isMove,

                                                         java.util.Map<TrackerLayoutLabelDto,TrackerLayoutLabelDto> fieldMapping,
                                                         com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.util.TrackerItemFieldHandler resolver)
        Transfer some items. Also transfers subtasks if necessary.
        Parameters:
        user - is the user that executes the copy/move
        transaction - is the copy/move transaction
        tracker - is the target tracker
        parent - is the target parent item, or null
        position - defines the position relative to parent, defaults to Position.Child if not specified
        isMove - true for moving the items, false for copying
        linkCopiedItems - defines the association between the copied item and the original item, or null to not create associations.
        items - List of current TrackerItemDtos to transfer
        itemMap - is a lookup Map of all items to transfer
        baseline - is the baseline where to get the item and associations to copy
        copiedAttachments - is a Map where to store copied item attachments (old instance to copied instance)
        copiedAssociations - is a List where to store copied item associations
        Returns:
        Map contains the source TrackerItemDtos as keys, and the TrackerItemDtos transferred as values

      • getAttachments

        public static java.util.List<com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.util.TrackerItemAttachmentGroup> getAttachments(TrackerItemRevisionDto itemRevision,
                                                                                                java.util.Locale locale,
                                                                                                boolean ascending)
        Get the attachments of the specified tracker item revision as a sorted list of tracker item attachment groups, that reflect
        • the item baseline status
        • the attachment hierarchy
        Parameters:
        itemRevision - is the
        locale - for sorting attachments by name
        ascending - true to return groups in ascending order and in proper hierarchy layer, false to return groups flat descending
        Returns:
        the attachments of the specified tracker item revision
